III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & 722.120 Investigation, inspection, and examination of
Section conditions, books, records, and reports; access by
Description department, bureau of fire services, or local authorities;
records; report; forms; confidentiality; disclosure of
information; availability of confidential records; child
information cards to be provided to department; failure of
licensee to cooperate with investigation, inspection, or
examination.
(1) The department may investigate, inspect, and examine
conditions of a childcare organization and may investigate and
examine the licensee's books and records. The licensee must
1

cooperate with the department's investigation, inspection, and
examination by doing all of the following:
(b) Allowing the department to perform routine investigative
functions during the course of an investigation, inspection, or
examination. Routine investigative functions include, but are not
limited to, interviewing potential witnesses, such as staff and
household members, and taking photographs to assess and
document the conditions of the childcare organization and its
compliance with this act and the rules promulgated under this act.
(c) Providing accurate and truthful information to the
department, and encouraging witnesses, such as staff and
household members, to provide accurate and truthful information
to the department.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member was threatened to be fired if they cooperated with
MDHHS or DCWL. During a staff meeting, administration advised
staff not to cooperate with MDHHS or DCWL.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant reported via email on September 8, 2025, she
had no additional information.
MDHHS Worker was interviewed via telephone on September 8,
2025. MDHHS Worker reported she spoke with Staff 1 over the
phone on September 5, 2025. MDHHS Worker said Staff 1
sounded like she was crying and was talking very fast. MDHHS
Worker said Staff 1 told her she was in the bathroom at work and
had just been called into “the office” and “they” told her if she kept
talking to DCWL and MDHHS she “would be fired”. MDHHS
Worker said Staff 1 did not disclose who “they” were. MDHHS
Worker said Staff 1 also reported that on Thursday there was a
staff meeting where “they” told staff what to say during
investigations. MDHHS Worker said she questioned Staff 1 about
this further as it would be difficult for someone to tell staff what to
say during an interview if they are unaware of the questions being
asked. MDHHS Worker said Staff 1 said staff are to only answer
the questions asked and not give more information than that as
staff are giving “too much information” to DCWL and MDHHS.
MDHHS Worker said she asked Staff 1 specifically if staff were
being told not to talk to cooperate with DCWL and MDHHS and
she said no, no one told them they are not to meet with or talk to
DCWL or MDHHS just that they need to stick to answering only
the questions being asked of them.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on September 10, 2025.
Staff 1 said Vice President ran the team meeting on September 4,
2

2025. Staff 1 said during the team meeting Vice President told
staff if they are interviewed by MDHHS or DCWL for an
investigation they need to answer the questions asked of them
and not volunteer additional information that they are not asked.
Staff 1 denied ever being told not to cooperate or talk to MDHHS
or DCWL. Staff 1 said neither Vice President nor Program Director
have met with her individually or threatened her in any way. Staff 1
said she was recently terminated from Wolverine Human Services
and was told it was due to inappropriate communication with youth
about drugs.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on October
7, 2025. Staff 2 said she does remember a conversation from “a
higher up”, but she could not remember who, telling her and other
staff that when talking to DCWL and MDHHS to be honest and
answer all questions and that if they did not know an answer just
say that and do not make anything up just to have an answer.
Staff 2 said the staff were told that they may get called on their
personal phones so to make sure and answer or call back timely.
Staff 2 said they were told if they wanted a support person to sit in
on interviews that was allowed, and they just needed to ask for
someone. Staff 2 denied ever being told not to talk to DCWL or
MDHHS.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on October
7, 2025. Staff 3 said she remembered someone, she could not
remember who or when, talked to her about interviews with DCWL
and MDHHS. Staff 3 said she was just told to be “truthful” and “not
to give information just to have an answer”, if they do not know
they just say, “I don’t know”.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on October 8, 2025.
Staff 4 said Program Director pulled her and other staff aside
during one of her shifts and told them they had the option to have
someone sit in on their interviews with DCWL and MDHHS. Staff 4
said Program Director told them that other staff had reported their
“words were being twisted” from what they said in the interview to
what was in the report so if they did not feel comfortable being
alone they could have a support person with them. Staff 4 denied
ever being told they did not have to talk to DCWL or MDHHS.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on October 9, 2025.
Staff 5 said no one has ever told her not to talk to DCWL or
MDHHS. Staff 5 said she was told that she will be informed by
supervisors or administrators if DCWL or MDHHS needs to
interview her and she is to watch for the call on her phone and
3

make sure to answer or return the call. Staff 5 said she was
informed that she can have a support person sit in on her
interview with DCWL and MDHHS if she wants.
Supervisor A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 7, 2025. Supervisor A said he and the other supervisors
will conduct the team meetings each week with staff, stating Vice
President and Program Director might stop into a meeting but they
do not run the meetings. Supervisor A said he has not heard
anything regarding meeting with DCWL or MDHHS being
discussed during any of the team meetings. Supervisor A said he
has never been directed not to meet with DCWL or MDHHS.
Supervisor B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 7, 2025. Supervisor B said it is common for her and the
other supervisors to run team meetings with staff. Supervisor B
said she has never had discussions with staff regarding DCWL or
MDHHS in team meetings or at any other time. Supervisor B said
Vice President does not attend team meetings and Program
Director will stop in but does not conduct the meetings. Supervisor
B said she has never been directed not to meet with DCWL or
MDHHS.
Vice President was interview via telephone on October 21,
2025. Vice President reported she was not present for the staff
meeting on September 4, 2025, noting she does not attend staff
meetings. Vice President said she has never told staff not to
cooperate or speak to DCWL or MDHHS.
Program Director was interviewed via telephone on October
21, 2025. Program Director said she does not recall the exact
dates but reported she has participated in several staff meetings
where she told staff they are allowed to have a support person sit
in on their interviews with DCWL and MDHHS if they chose.
Program Director denied ever pulling staff to the side to speak to
them regarding meeting with DCWL or MDHHS. Program Director
said she has never told staff they do not need to meet with DCWL
or MDHHS.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff interviews the
administration is not directing staff not to talk to DCWL or MDHHS
or cooperate with an investigation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
